intro: Matthiola caboverdeana, commonly known as Cape Verde stock, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale purple, arranged in racemes. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and pleasant scent. Matthiola caboverdeana prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
